result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bianca Shante Whyte

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Bianca Shante Whyte in court.  Attorney Christin Marie Saint Pierre in court for Bianca Shante Whyte.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Bianca Shante Whyte not in court.  Attorney Christin Marie Saint Pierre appeared by video for Bianca Shante Whyte.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court waives defendants appearance for today. Court in receipt of defense motion to adjourn. Court grants adjournment. Case adjourned. Case remains calendared in Br 15.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defense Motion For Continuance; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant Bianca Shante Whyte in court with attorney Christin Marie Saint Pierre.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bianca Shante Whyte appeared by video means with Attorney.
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case in court for deferred prosecution agreement (DPA) hearing. Due to court reporter availability, Court orders DPA hearing adjourned to an in person date.
Court ordered case adjourned for DPA hearing in Branch 15.

  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights
Received and Filed.
Waiver of personal appearance
Deferred Prosecution Agreement
Received and Filed by Attorney Saint Pierre
Received and Filed.

Defendant Bianca Shante Whyte in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for status conference. Case in DPA posture. Defendant does not qualify for public defender representation. Indigency Hearing held. 
Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by the court.  
Defendant agreed to repay Milwaukee County for the fees and expense paid by Milwaukee County. 
The court appointed Attorney Saint Pierre to represent defendant  at County expense at the rate of $100.00 per hour.
Defendant repay the County at a rate of $45.00 Per Month. Repayment to begin 60 Days after the conclusion of the case.  Defendant advised failure to pay will result in a Civil Judgment 
Court ordered matter adjourned.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Bianca Shante Whyte in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a Pretrial Conference. Defendant represent herself. State sent discovery link and offer to  defendant's email on 5/2/2022.
Defendant moves for dismissal. Court Denied Defendant's motion. 
Court encourage defendant to contact the State public Office for appointment on counsel and provided defendant with their phone number.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Bianca Shante Whyte in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant appears in court pro se.   Defendant wishes to proceed without counsel.  Upon questioning, the Court finds the defendant competent to proceed and knowingly and voluntarily waives right to counsel. Waiver of Right to Attorney, signed and filed. Case remains calendared in Br. 19.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant appeared at 8:30am. Request to appear in person and request to represent herself. 
Defendant provided with waiver of attorney form, centro legal resource information and State public defendant phone number.
Pretrial Conference scheduled May 2, 2022 at 8:30am.
Pre-trial conference on April 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (3-23-2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with any Ross Dress for Less store.

Defendant Bianca Shante Whyte in court.  Kathryn Ginsberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 19.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Bianca Shante Whyte not in court.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/10/22 @ 1p
